我为何返回学术界

一点非学术的杂想

May 19, 2024

My only love sprung from my only hate!

Too early seen unknown, and known too late!

Prodigious birth of love it is to me,

That I must love a loathed enemy.

—Romeo and Juliet : I.v.142–145

最近做出了一个并不轻松的选择——决定辞去博士毕业后开始两年不到的工业界工作，作为普通博士后重返大学，继续基础研究。

还有离开了九年的新英格兰，独闯人文环境


一

问题—Is it still fun to do science?

Madame, vous voyez la science de haut, comme une vaste tapisserie. Je la vois d'en bas, au niveau du petit point.

[Madam, you look at science from a top level and see it as a vast tapestry. I look at it from the bottom up and notice the details of every single stitch.]

—Pierre-Gilles de Gennes (2002)


He's sitting there, away from the madding crowd that's stampeding up and down the aisle and, actually, he's trying to isolate himself because, in fact, shortly he will be isolated for a long period of time in the lonely north.

—Glenn Gould (1967)
